review_blob:
Pours cloudy dark amber almost like it's unfiltered. Hints of banana on the nose. Full bodied flavor with the woody-ness of the oak barrels. Only downside is the aftertaste that is the same as all Sierra Nevada brews...grapefruit. Still...loved it. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

WOW!!! That's all I can say! Nice wood aroma...the smell of barrels. I've never had rye whiskey before but this could make me try it. Nice smoky flavor. You can taste the alcohol as you sip. Warms the throat for sure. I'll buy more of this while it's still around. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
beer_name: The Bruery Smoking Wood - Rye Barrel

review_blob:
Awesome oak aroma! Smells like a room full of oak casks. Pours thick with a dark caramel color. Malty flavor with notes of caramel with woody highlights. Thick like a Barleywine but definitely a different flavor. Love it!! 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Big citrus and floral aroma. Pours a light amber...nice lacing. Big citrus flavor and very fresh tasting. Big bite on the palate yet leaves a nice grapefruit aftertaste. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Definitely not what I expected. I love a great Barleywine but this was not as wine-y as I expected. A little thin, not thick like others. I also expected a bourbon flavor but was disappointed that it just wasn't there. I've had other beers from this brewery that were much better. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

What a hop-monster this beer is! Clocking in at 112, it has a huge taste. I actually had some a couple months ago but hadn't seen it in my area until I happened upon it yesterday! Dark amber color that pours with very little head. Rich piney/citrusy aromas. Love, love, love the flavor! Not overly citrusy and has a nice, balanced, pine flavor. I hope I find more of this hoppy treasure! 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

I'm not much of a lager fan...really more of a double IPA and big stout guy. I wasn't surprised by the ratings of this beer. A little bland in comparison to what I'm used to. Would love to have tried this with a maltier base. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

A friend of mine gave this to me as a gift. I had never heard of it until then. I wasn't expecting much. Wow! I was taken by surprise! Rich black color that reminded me of a stout. But the real surprise was the flavor. The boldness of the hops...just what I enjoy. The rich, piney, citrus flavor gave way to a hint if licorice. This is now one of my new favorites. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Smell the hops! From the moment I opened the can it was powerful. As I poured it into my snifter the aroma was intoxicating. Great piny flavor...just like the name you could taste the hop resin. Loved it. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Awesome taste!! A great marriage of Belgian and west coast IPA! I definitely love the way the Belgian fruitiness balances the grapefruit flavor. Definitely one of my new favorites. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours very dark. I used a snifter. More head than I expected but dark chocolate color. Definitely a high alcohol content. Had a bourbon flavor to it. Not my favorite but very good. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Smell the hops!! Pours and looks like a stout...but underneath that costume is a great black IPA! Hops on the nose...hops on the palate. Definitely an IPA in disguise. Love, love, love it!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Nice citrusy notes in the nose. Moderately bitter hoppiness. Flavor is more nutty that grape fruity. Definitely a good blend of hops that has an interesting taste that leaves you wanting another. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Love the piney scent of the hops. Pours a translucent amber color with an unusually big head for a high ABV brew. My favorite line from Spinal Tap...well used for this beer! 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Can you say "kick a##"?? Wow! Nice warm bourbon scent. The flavor is a great blend of imperial stout with the perfect blend of bourbon flavor. A special treat for sure!!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours a nice amber color with nice head. Have it a chance to calm down and release the flavors. Loved the bitterness of the Centennial hops. For 58 IBUs it was very hoppy. Can't wait to finish the other half of the bottle. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
beer_name: Dogfish Head Hellhound On My Ale

review_blob:
Pours thick and black with very little head. Love the mix of alcohol and dark chocolate. Definitely some black cherry notes with the dark chocolate bitter aftertaste. I favorite for sure! 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Wow! Big, bold flavor! Thick and chewy for sure. Black in color so it lives up to its name. Definitely one of my favorite stouts. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
beer_name: BrewDog / Ngne  / Mikkeller Black Tokyo* Horizon

review_blob:
Pours thick with very little head. Not quite as heavy tasting as it poured and smelled. Nice bitter aftertaste with a light but malty flavor. Definitely one I will purchase again. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
beer_name: Bear Republic Big Bear Black Stout

review_blob:
Very interesting flavor. I was pleasantly surprised by the notes added from the Pinot noir aging. It added a nice, classy flavor to the high alcohol content. Nose is full of wine-like aroma and the aftertaste is reminiscent of a good glass of Pinot noir. I highly recommend this with a good ribeye grilled medium rate on the the BBQ!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Dark amber color with a nice head. Great bitter flavor of hoppiness from heaven! Love the aftertaste of yellow grapefruit but without the fruitiness of many west coast IPAs. If you're a hop fan this is definitely a must for your list. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

WOW!!! That's the one word that came to mind with the first sip. The nose is filled with the scent of dark, strong coffee setting the taste buds up for a treat. Definitely a full bodied taste just like an Imperial Russian Stout should be. Add in the flavor of a good strong cup of espresso along with some chocolate notes and violas...you have one of the best stouts ever. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Very thick like a Barley Wine should be. Hint of figs and apricots. Nice bitter aftertaste...love the hoppiness! The aroma of apricots mixed with the piny scent of the hops makes your nose come alive. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Nice and thick as you sip it. Hints of chocolate in the nose. Explodes on the palate with coffee and dark chocolate notes. There's a bit of bitterness from the hops...very tasty. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours thick and dark with a lighter brown head. You can definitely taste the raisiny, licorice taste. Powerful but fours down gently. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
beer_name: Left Hand Wake Up Dead Imperial Stout - Barrel-Aged

review_blob:
Very interesting brew. Suede is either a light stout or a heavy porter. Either way it's quite a treat. Nice smoky malt after taste with the thickness and punch of a stout. Dark in color but with a tan head. Live the full bodied flavor. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
beer_name: 10 Barrel / Bluejacket / Stone Suede Imperial Porter

review_blob:
Very smooth, creamy taste. Rich dark color with a cream color head. Similar to Expedition Stout. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Definitely a hop beast. Lived the 100 IBUs! Full flavor with some fruit notes in the aftertaste. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

This is an IPA that tried to be a Porter. It just couldn't break away from its hoppy-ness! Had this on tap in San Francisco. One of the best black IPAs I've had. Great hoppy bitterness with a hint of the nutty taste of the darker malt. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Great hoppy beer! Amber in color, not too clear but just dirty enough. Definite grapefruit notes in the aftertaste. The bitterness of the hops hangs on your tongue. Had it on tap in San Francisco. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Loved this beer!! Had it on tap in Columbia, SC. One of my new favorite stouts. I hope I can find it in FL! Excellent stout flavor...reminded me of my two faves but the addition of the bourbon flavors really set it apart! 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Lighter than a typical stout...almost Porterish, but very tasty! Definitely a clear choice if you don't like a heavy stout. Very nutty flavor. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Very tasty. Definitely much hoppier than the typical lager. A little weak for my personal taste but I sure won't turn one down!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
